Run Strategy Backtest

Source: R/backtest.R
backtest.Rd

Executes a complete backtest of a trading strategy on market data. Supports both vectorized (fast, signal-based) and event-driven (realistic, order-based) backtesting methods.

Usage

backtest(
  data,
  initial_capital = 10000,
  method = "vectorized",
  commission = NULL,
  slippage = NULL,
  position_size_method = "fixed",
  max_positions = 1,
  margin_requirement = 1,
  compound = TRUE
)

Arguments

data

A market_tbl object with strategy signals (from add_strategy())

initial_capital

Numeric value of starting capital

method

Character: "vectorized" or "event_driven"

commission

Numeric: commission rate (overrides strategy commission if provided)

slippage

Numeric: slippage rate (overrides strategy slippage if provided)

position_size_method

Character: position sizing method

max_positions

Integer: maximum number of concurrent positions (default: 1)

margin_requirement

Numeric: margin requirement as fraction (default: 1, no leverage)

compound

Boolean: whether to compound returns (default: TRUE)

Value

A backtest_results object containing trades, equity curve, and statistics

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
library(tradeengine)

# Run a simple backtest
results <- prices |>
  add_strategy(
    entry_rules = close > sma_20,
    exit_rules = close < sma_20
  ) |>
  backtest(initial_capital = 10000, method = "vectorized")

# View results
summary(results)
plot(results)
} # }
